file_content.text: Thank you for your assistance.
I can't believe you got the data spike instead of the parts for my friend. Now you leave me no choice.
You will do as I say, droid.
That's correct.
It's time you returned to your duties.
This is for the best.
Hurry it up.
Repairing personality protocol. Functions resetting to standard. Please stand by.
Excuse me now. My current assignment is to prevent enemy incursion into this zone, so I must stay alert.
Your... your assistance is... is appreciated.
You retrieved the motivator! 5TM, you're going to make it!
I will begin repairs. Hopefully, once I return to full functionality, I can get you to resume our duties.
I cannot thank you enough, brave organic! Here--these are the coordinates for the supply cache I promised.
No problem.
Then we're done.
At least there's a reward.
Do not be so modest about your heroic efforts!
Farewell, brave organic!
I can't believe you're worrying about my programming while my comrade lies damaged on the battlefield!
As soon as we have that new motivator, you'll be as good as new, brother!
Help me! You there! Yes, you! Please!
My comrade took severe damage while engaging the enemy--please, we have to repair him!
Do not waste these organics' time. I am damaged beyond reasonable field repair. Proceed with assigned contingency 57-8B.
Do not waste the time of an organic. The damage to my motivator exceeds reasonable repair. Continue our assigned task alone.
I can't just leave you out here! I will return you to headquarters fully operational, brother. I have to.
I didn't realize that droids could have such strong emotions.
You care a lot for a droid.
This is my counterpart! My comrade! I can't just leave him in this war zone to face destruction alone. I have to save him!
Stand in my way and I'll destroy you both, droid.
Move aside--now.
The droid is worried about his little friend. Adorable!
Aw, how sweet.
Your buddy is scrap, pal. Get back to your job.
Get over it.
No! He can make it, we just have to help him!
What is your assigned task, droid? Why are you here?
Are you malfunctioning?
We were guarding the area perimeter when my comrade was damaged by enemy fire.
You're boring me.
Unit B-6NX carries experimental emotional programming, which may be the cause of his current malfunction.
Camaraderie and compassion increase unit cohesion, thereby increasing combat effectiveness by a factor of five!
The observed result is that your programming prevents you from ignoring my damage and carrying out mission priorities--a clear flaw.
Don't listen to him. This single-use passcard will open a hidden supply locker in the nearby junkyard. You can retrieve a new motivator, and we can repair my comrade!
Using our assigned passcard in order to repair me is a waste, 6NX.
If the organics wish to help, they should use the card to retrieve a data spike to counteract your flawed emotional programming.
The card, and the organic's time, would be better used retrieving a data spike to erase your flawed emotional programming.
I could spare some time to get you back to your duties.
Something should be done.
I'll gladly forego a few moments of carnage to get the two of you sorted out.
I could help.
I've got some time between jobs, if you need help.
Guess I should lend a hand.
If neither of you can complete your assignments, then action must be taken.
Something needs to be done.
Couldn't I find a new motivator and a data spike, and fix you both?
Why not do both?
Data spikes and motivators are stored separately, and the card will only open one secured case.
I am incapable of engaging enemy soldiers, whereas unit B-6NX only chooses not to. Repairing his faulty programming is the most expedient solution.
Engaging those resistance fighters would have subjected you to further risk of damage! I couldn't take that chance.
Please--take this card and retrieve the motivator to repair my friend. Please. I can even reward your help!
I know the location of another supply cache--one that isn't locked. Its contents will surely be useful to you.
Bribery, refusal to carry out programmed directives... my counterpart's malfunctions are obvious. Please retrieve a data spike to correct him.
Your counterpart definitely needs to be reprogrammed. Where can I find what we need?
Let's remove those emotions.
You should be able to find the necessary data spike in the nearby junkyard. Use the passcard that 6NX gave you to retrieve it from its locked case.
But my comrade! He needs help! He needs a motivator....
Two battle droids are better than one. I'm going to find that motivator you need.
We should repair your damage.
Excellent--as I said before, you should find one in a locked case, hidden in the junkyard. You're going to make it, buddy!
Such a waste of time and resources....
Not my problem. [Refuse quest]
Don't worry, comrade. We'll find someone else. We'll get you out of this.
You're just wasting your time....
I apologize, but my mission parameters do not permit conversation at this time.
